fields.summary: S3A Analytics-Accelerator: AAL stream factory not being closed
fields.description: When the Factory service is stopped, we're currently missing the code to close the factory. My miss, this got lost in the move to the new factory code.

comments.body:
ahmarsuhail opened a new pull request, #7616:
URL: https://github.com/apache/hadoop/pull/7616

   ### Description of PR
   
   Current integration code wasn't closing the AAL stream factory on service stop. 
   
   This PR adds that logic in and a statistic to ensure close gets called. 
   
   ### How was this patch tested?
   
   Ran `ITestS3AAnalyticsAcceleratorStreamReading`, will run the whole test suite sooon.

ahmarsuhail commented on PR #7616:
URL: https://github.com/apache/hadoop/pull/7616#issuecomment-2807036987

   @steveloughran @mukund-thakur  small PR to close AAL stream factory on service stop, missed that in the factory refactor. 
   
   Was debating if that stasitic should be a generic `OBJECT_INPUT_STREAM_FACTORY_CLOSED` and be incremented in the serviceStop of `AbstractObjectInputStreamFactory`. But wasn't sure. the other stream factories don't need this because their factories don't hold any state, AAL does. let me know what you think.
